page.title: 03HISTORY - ETTRICK VALLEY
page.content: East of 'Yiddie's Yet'(Adam's Gate), where the road forded the river to Ettrickside (a small farm on Thirlestane estate but no longer there) is the Caller Wall(well),one of the few remaining horse troughs in the valley. a hundred yards further on is the Smiddy where Andrew Shankie was the last resident blacksmith and lived at Shankend. Next is Dundas Cottage with its white dog landmark and then the farm of Wardlaw. Up the back road is Thirlestanehope. There is a drove road known as The Captain's Road from here to St. Mary's Loch, Crosscleugh, Bourhope and Tibbie Shiel's Inn which goes past Shepherdscleugh where Wattie Scott, the renowned Post, Carrier and Minister's man in Ettrick was born over a century ago.
